text: She had earned the right to be left in peace. Byron's fame was of course very wonderful, but it carried with it too many reminders of his terrible indiscretions-the writing of Don Juan, which she had never ceased to deplore, his shocking blasphemies like the Vision of Judgement, his making friends with the atheist known to her as 'that infamous Mr. Shelley and his mixing with really low and horrid people such as the subversive journalist Leigh Hunt, whom one would never conceivably meet in decent society.
